title.narrative: Women's Action for Voice and Empowerment Program

description.narrative: Goal: Women lead transformative, sustainable change towards Gender Equality, enabled by strategic feminist engagement Impact 1: Individual women's leadership influences political, economic and social decisions Outcome 1: Women, including young women, are in influential political, civic and business leadership positions. Intermediate Outcome 1a: Women are supported to achieve and retain elected office Intermediate Outcome 1b: Women Leaders have greater support and opportunities within community, economic and social spheres Output 1.1: Women in politics develop leadership skills and influence Output 1.2: Women have increased skills and confidence to engage in civic, social and economic leadership Output 1.3: Young women have increased skills and confidence to engage in leadership Output 1.4: Women lead responses to violence against women Output 1.5: Men, including young men, are increasinginly engaged in male advocates programme Impact 2: Power holders and institutions are responsive to and accountable for women's rights and status Outcome 2: Individual champions and institutional processes bring increased realisation of women's rights Intermediate Outcome 2a: Normative Frameworks that support women are in place at local, subnational and/or national level Intermediate Outcome 2b: Duty bearers are willing, resourced and supported to implement normative frameworks Output 2.1: Advocacy plan developed and implemented focused on CPP and EVAW which uses targeted channels and platforms to advance women's priorities Output 2.2: Partner monitoring and reporting on government performance against obligations creates accountability push Output 2.3: Duty bearers are have increased knowledge of and willingness to implement policy, budget and legal changes to support women Impact 3: A vital, visible and vocal women's movement aggregates and amplifies women's power and priorities Outcome 3: Autonomous women's organisations, groups, networks and coalitions collaborate on common goals and shared objectives Intermediate Outcome 3a: National and regional women's movements are strengthened Intermediate Outcome 3b: Individual women and women's movements are able to represent issues at strategic national and international forums Output 3.1: Programme provides space and resources to support the formation and development of national and regional women's movements Output 3.2: Individual women's organisations have strengthened capacity to commit and engage Impact 4: Evidence of how change towards gender equality happens informs individuals, institutions and movements Outcome 4: Iterative advocacy and learning is enhanced by inclusive and systematic research collaborations Intermediate Outcome 4a: Evidence is used in programming and linked to advocacy Output 4.1: Research, Evidence and Learning Framework is developed and resourced to generate research and evidence outputs Output 4.2: Research and advocacy networks are developed that reflect diversity and experience

The WAVE program will achieve impact in four nested areas: * Individuals – Developing women leaders and leadership capabilities across generations * Political and Governance Systems – Generating change to inequitable legal, policy and economic frameworks * Women’s Movement and CSO’s – Catalysing collective action and accountability for women’s rights and gender equality * Research, Evidence and Learning – Applying knowledge from women’s voice and lived experiences to advocacy and policy settings
Women, young women, young men, duty bearers, political parties, government officials, women candidates, women parliamentarians

title.narrative: Outcome 2 d By December 2020, 50% of duty bearers targeted report increased awareness of their obligations and responsibilities relating to relevant normative framework (e.g. domestic violence laws, labour laws, gender based violence action plans, TSM etc.) and/ or have changed their position on the issue targeted

description.narrative: By December 2020, 50% of duty bearers targeted report increased awareness of their obligations and responsibilities relating to relevant normative framework (e.g. domestic violence laws, labour laws, gender based violence action plans, TSM etc.) and/ or have changed their position on the issue targeted

comment.narrative: New program, baseline is zero.

percent of duty bearers targeted report increased awareness of their obligations and responsibilities relating to relevant normative framework (e.g.. domestic violence laws, labour laws, gender based violence action plans, TSM etc.) and/or have changed their position on the issue targetted

This indicator has proved too difficult to track as partners cannot complete pre-post testing with duty bearers (too politically sensitive) and also duty bearers change often so tracking their awareness over time is not possible. This indicator will therefore be scrapped. IWDA plans to collect qualitative data around duty bearer awareness of obligations at end-line.

title.narrative: Outcome 3 Individual organisations, national and regional women's movements are strengthened and women leaders and movements effectively collaborate in strategic national and international forums

description.narrative: Individual organisations, national and regional women's movements are strengthened and women leaders and movements effectively collaborate in strategic national and international forums

title.narrative: Outcome 3.b Partners ability to commit and engage is increased (25 % partners to very high, 25% to high, 50% to moderate)

description.narrative: Partners ability to commit and engage is increased (25 % partners to very high, 25% to high, 50% to moderate)

comment.narrative: At baseline, Partners' self assessments of capability to commit and engage was as follows: 29% at Low, 43% at moderate, 14% at high and 7% at very high. The average, across all partners, was 50%.
A percentage score has been attributed to the categories: low (1-25%), moderate (26-50%), high (50-75%) and very high (76-100%). Target is 69% average across all partners.

Reporting this year shows that 20% of partners assessed their capacity to commit and engage as 'very high', 60% assessed their capacity as 'high', and 20% assessed their capacity as 'moderate'. This represents a program level average, across all partners, of 75%.

title.narrative: Intermediate Outcome 1a Women Leaders have greater support and opportunities within community, economic and social spheres

description.narrative: Women Leaders have greater support and opportunities within community, economic and social spheres

title.narrative: Intermediate Outcome 1a.b. By December 2020, an increased proportion of respondents in public perceptions of women in leadership survey support women's leadership and/or express more gender equitable attitudes

comment.narrative: Baseline not yet available. Will be established when perceptions surveys are implemented

As we are only undertaking one Perceptions of women as leaders research project in each country (Solomon Islands, Timor Leste and Cambodia) we will not be able to determine whether an increase has occured. Results from the 3 research projects will provide information at the goal level in exploring changes to gender norms (with impact, outcome and outcome information included at Impact 4). This indicator will be removed.

title.narrative: Intermediate Outcome 1a.a. By December 2020, 60% of women participants report they have the necessary support and opportunities to undertake leadership roles

comment.narrative: New program, baseline is zero.
% of women participants who report they have the necessary support and opportunities to undertake leadership roles
% of women participants who report they have the necessary support and opportunities to undertake leadership roles. Source: 2 partners collecting this information in 2016.

title.narrative: Outcome 1 Women and young women have greater opportunities and are supported in achieving and retaining influential and leadership positions in political civic and business spheres

description.narrative: Women and young women have greater opportunities and are supported in achieving and retaining influential and leadership positions in political civic and business spheres

title.narrative: Outcome 1c Increase in women willing to consider being a candidate and/or female candidates running and/or margins by which women lose elections are narrower

description.narrative: Increase in women willing to consider being a candidate and/or female candidates running and/or margins by which women lose elections are narrower

comment.narrative: Refer baseline report.
Refers to the number of new women willing to consider being a candidate and/or female candidates running. In 2017, three Cambodian partners reported against this indicator.

We can only collect data on the number of women who are participating in WAVE programs which is collected in other indicators. There is no other way to gauge general interest. This indicator will therefore be removed.

title.narrative: Outcome 1a By 2020, 75% of up to 1200 Women involved in the program report improved influence and / or occupy positions of substantive power in local, subnational, and national government and/or civic or private sector positions

description.narrative: By 2020, 75% of up to 1200 Women involved in the program report improved influence and / or occupy positions of substantive power in local, subnational, and national government and/or civic or private sector positions

comment.narrative: The baseline for this indicator is zero

Refers to the percentage of women involved in the program who report improved influence or occupy positions of substantive power, specifically in the political sphere. This year's result reflects the achievements of three Cambodian partners who together provided support to a total of 247 women candidates, of whom 107, or 43%, achieved elected office.
Refers to the percentage of women involved in the program who report improved influence or occupy positions of substantive power, specifically in the political sphere.

title.narrative: Outcome 1b By December 2020, number of seats held by women in national, subnational and local government increases by 25% across target countries

description.narrative: By December 2020, number of seats held by women in national, subnational and local government increases by 25% across target countries

comment.narrative: of seats held by women at ministerial, national and local level across all countries

8% is a 14% increase on the baseline of 7% seats held by women at ministerial, national and local level across all countries. Please note that there was an error in the original baseline calculation, which has now been corrected.
8% is a 14% increase on the baseline of 7% seats held by women at ministerial, national and local level across all countries.
